_header: I saw three headless playen at a ball

BodEngPoete1.Transcription:
I saw iij hedles playen at a ballon hanles man served hem
                    allwhyll iij movthles men lay & lowiij legles a way hem
                    drow
BodEngPoete1.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,
                        ed.  
             Songs and Carols from a manuscript…of the Fifteenth
                Century.
Percy Society
         23. London: Richards, 1847: 35 (as part of 3343).
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 241.
Silverstein,  Theodore,
                        ed.  
             Medieval English Lyrics.
         York Medieval Texts. London: Edw. Arnold, 1971: 144-5.

BodRawD328.Transcription:
iij heddelyse men playd at ballI heddelyse man seruit them
                    all
BodRawD328.Note:
Translating ‘Tres homines assifoli ad pilam
                    ludebant…’ (4 lines), which precedes.
BodRawD328.Editions:
Meech,  Sanford Brown. 
             “A Collection of Proverbs in Rawlinson MS D 328.” 
             Modern Philology
         38 (1940-41): 113-32: 125.
